summary: Directed evolution techniques enable the optimization of enzymes for specific applications through random mutagenesis and high-throughput screening, but face challenges due to the vast number of possible permutations and lack of clear target residues.
key_claims: Random mutagenesis combined with high-throughput screening is used in directed evolution to optimize enzyme properties.
The number of possible permutations for even a small change in an enzyme sequence can be extremely large (ca. 10^4).
High-throughput screens must handle libraries of ca. 10^5 - 10^9 variants to achieve significant improvements.
